page.title: 10BANGOUR VILLAGE HOSPITAL
page.content: Bangour Village Hospital is for treating mental disorders. It can take 611 patients. Building started in 1906 and was interrupted by the war and was finished in 1930. It was a{War {Hospital in World War 1}and a train transported wounded soldiers from the coast. It was called the{"Wee Bangour {Express"}and men from Deans Shale Works used to listen for the train's whistle when they would go down to the station at Bangour to help unload the casualties. In the grounds there is a Church which is{inter-denominational. There is also a snack bar,a recreation hall and a shop. The idea of a Village Hospital was to make patients feel they belonged to a community.{Future {plans}may be that it moves to the new {Livingston General Hospital}which is being built.
